content.body: if anyone wants to understand how that polyfill works, `scheduler.taskId` is a property enabled by that Chrome feature flag that is used for testing task attribution
content.formatted_body: if anyone wants to understand how that polyfill works, scheduler.taskId is a property enabled by that Chrome feature flag that is used for testing task attribution

content.body: basically, any time that (according to task attribution) a context should be propagated, the `scheduler.taskId` from the time the task gets scheduled gets copied and set on the scheduled task itself
content.formatted_body: basically, any time that (according to task attribution) a context should be propagated, the scheduler.taskId from the time the task gets scheduled gets copied and set on the scheduled task itself

content.body: even if the task id gets set by JS code
and new tasks without a dispatch context get new ID's (starting from 1; 0 being the initial context)
